lines: The phone rings while Daddy is ironing a shirt. He must leave you alone in the room with the iron.
The iron is heavy and hard to manage. You try to push it across the shirt with two hands.
Dad comes in just before you burn yourself and ruin his shirt.
You accidentally touch the iron and burn your finger. The iron falls on the floor and burns a hole in the carpet.
You leave the iron on top of Dad's shirt and it burns a hole right through it.
You could have gotten burned very badly, even though you were trying to be helpful.
Ouch! You burn your hand on the hot iron. It falls to the floor with a thud. When you try to pick it up from the floor you pick it up by the metal part and burn your hand badly.
Dad realizes that you are alone with the hot iron and calls you in to him.
You run into the room and trip over the iron cord.
The iron wobbles but remains upright. You have avoided getting hurt.
The iron falls on the floor and burns a hole in the carpet. It's not your fault.
You fall onto the floor and the hot iron lands on your hands and arms. It hurts a lot. You are taken to the hospital.
You suffer minor burns. Young skin heals quickly. You were very lucky.
You suffer second degree burns on your hands and arms. You are bandaged to the elbow on both sides. You will have some permanent scarring.
